intro: Pseudoconnarus reticulatus, commonly known as the reticulate pseudoconnarus, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the natural environment.
